lines.text: Be seeing you.
I will not make any deals with you. I've resigned. I will not be pushed, filed, stamped, indexed, briefed, debriefed or numbered. My life is my own. I resign.
I am not a number. I am a person.
Good, you are honest. That is of use. Honesty attracts confidence, and confidence is our core of our business. See how honest I am being with you?
I'm the boss.
No. One is the boss.

[about The Prisoner]
He's an individual, and they're always trying.
Everybody votes for a dictator.
The trouble with science is that it can be perverted.
Bad habit of mine, playing with lighters. I'll probably start a fire one day.
If I knew where I was sailing from I could calculate where I was sailing to.
Last week, Number 14 was an old lady in a wheelchair. You're new here, and you're one of them.
I also have a problem. I'm not sure which side runs this Village.

[shouting]
Why, why, why did you resign?
Unlike me, many of you have accepted the situation of your imprisonment, and will die here like rotten cabbages.
Thanks for the trip, dad.

[Tearfully]
How can you doubt me?
It's easy, and I'm waterproof; a little drizzle won't wash away my doubt.
[Postman delivers a letter]
Special delivery. Sign your number here, Number Six.
I've been hypnotised by you long enough.
